page.title: 21Updating a day in the life of Joanne
page.content:
I think that I'm the Joanne that wrote this article in 1986. How times have changed. I still remember Mrs Keeling and her amazing animals. Since then I've married Lee and we've had three lovely children, aged 7, 5 and 3. We are now living in Dorset.

My children's school day is very different as school starts at 8.30 and finishes at 4.15 for them, though they still have cooked dinners which is very unsual nowadays.

Also I was one of the children along with my brother in the plane... I still remember that day flying over our home in Ibstock.

Everytime we go to through Heather we always look at the trees that my class planted on the road to Ibstock. I also vividly remember Mr Hughes reading "Pilgrim's Progress" to us and I think this must have started my love of books along with The Famous Five!

Contribution by: Joanne Edmond
